steps: Wash your hands before touching the wound.
Apply gentle pressure with a clean cloth to stop the bleeding.
Clean the wound with water only. Avoid using alcohol or iodine.
Apply an antibiotic ointment and cover it with a sterile bandage.
Seek medical help if the bleeding is severe or doesn't stop.
Remove the person from the heat source.

Do not apply ice, butter, or creams.
Cover the burn with a clean, non-stick dressing.
Seek medical help for deep or large burns.
Ask the person if they can speak or cough.
If not, deliver 5 back blows between the shoulder blades.
Repeat the cycle until the object is dislodged or help arrives.
Call emergency services immediately if the person becomes unconscious.
